alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Throckmorton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 08 at 1:46PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Haskell and northern Throckmorton Counties through 230 PM CST... At 145 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Millers Creek Reservoir, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Millers Creek Reservoir, Elbert and Us-183 Near The Throckmorton- Baylor County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
